nodes.bodyText: Can we just say that it does mean this? Seems like a reasonable statement.

+.. _streaming-trait:
+
+``streaming`` trait
+-------------------
+
+Summary
+    Indicates that the the data stored in the shape is very large and should
+    not be stored in memory, or that the size of the data stored in the shape
+    is unknown at the start of a request.
+Trait selector::
+    ``:each(operation -[input, output]-> structure > :test(member > blob), :test(member:of(structure[trait|error]) > blob))``
+Value type
+    ``structure``
+
+The value of the ``streaming`` trait is a structure that supports the following
+optional members:
+
+.. list-table::
+    :header-rows: 1
+    :widths: 10 10 80
+
+    * - Property
+      - Type
+      - Description
+    * - requiresLength
+      - ``boolean``
+      - Indicates that the stream must have a known size.
+
+        In an HTTP-based protocol, for instance, this might indicate that the

nodes.bodyText:
Can you provide a comment below the expression to explain the expression? Lots of other traits do this when the selector is complex.
And one other thing... let's remove the ability to use streaming on errors. It's not used in any AWS services today, and removing this ability would allow us to improve polymorphic type serialization so that we don't need the x-amz-error-target header anymore. We can always add this back later if we really want to support it.
